scarcity.description: Scarcity index (0–10000, pad 5): 0 = full density (continuous, unbroken texture), 10000 = absolute scarcity (single isolated events or no texture elements). Zero-padded. Used to quantify how 'populated' the waveform is with discrete or overlapping textural elements.

granularity.description: Granularity class: Z = coarsest (lowest detail, longest events or grain size), A = finest (highest microstructure, rapid fluctuations). Z-A order, single letter, Z always lowest, A highest.

layering.description: Layer count (0–1000, pad 4): number of simultaneously present independent textural streams. 0 = monolayer, 1000 = ultra-dense multi-layered. Zero-padded.

variation.description: Internal variation index (0–10000, pad 5): 0 = perfectly uniform (identical repetition), 10000 = maximum possible variation (no repetition or pattern). Zero-padded.

spectral.description: Spectral distribution class: Z = lowest (darkest, lowest frequency energy), A = brightest (highest frequency energy dominates). Z-A order, single letter, Z always first as lowest.

description: TEX (prefix), scarcity (5 digits), granularity (Z-A, 1 letter), layering (4 digits), variation (5 digits), spectral (Z-A, 1 letter); all zero-padded, no subvar prefixes. Example: TEX05321D007600137Z = scarcity 5321, granularity D, layering 0076, variation 00137, spectral Z.
